apply.description: The apply tag allows you to apply Twig filters on a block of template data.

autoescape.description: Whether automatic escaping is enabled or not, you can mark a section of a template to be escaped or not.

block.description: Blocks are used for template inheritance. When a template uses inheritance and you want to print a block multiple times, use the block function.

cache.description: The cache tag tells Twig that a template fragment should be cached.

embed.description: The embed tag combines the behaviour of include and extends. It allows you to include another template's contents and override any block defined inside the included template.

for.description: Loop over each item in a sequence.

guard.description: The guard tag checks if Twig callables (functions, filters, tests) are available at compilation time to bypass code that would otherwise fail. Added in Twig 3.15.

if.description: The if statement in Twig is comparable with the if statements of PHP.

macro.description: Macros are comparable with functions in regular programming languages. They are useful to reuse template fragments to not repeat yourself.

sandbox.description: The sandbox tag can be used to enable the sandboxing mode for an included template, when sandboxing is not enabled globally for the Twig environment. Deprecated as of Twig 3.15.

setb.description: Inside code blocks you can assign values to variables using the set tag with block syntax.

verbatim.description: The verbatim tag marks sections as being raw text that should not be parsed. Useful for putting Twig syntax as example into a template.

with.description: Use the with tag to create a new inner scope. Variables set within this scope are not visible outside of the scope.
